skill.name: nodejs-backend-patterns
skill.description: Build production-ready Node.js backend services with Express/Fastify, implementing middleware patterns, error handling, authentication, database integration, and API design best practices. Use when creating Node.js servers, REST APIs, GraphQL backends, or microservices architectures.
skill.summary: Build production-ready Node.js backend services with Express/Fastify, implementing middleware patter...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns found. The file contains instructional code examples aligned with the stated backend guidance.

content.value_statement: Many backend projects start without clear structure and security practices. This skill provides proven Node.js patterns for secure, maintainable services.
actual_capabilities: Provides Express and Fastify server setup examples with middleware
Details layered architecture with controller, service, and repository patterns
Includes authentication and authorization middleware examples with JWT
Shows validation middleware using Zod schemas
Covers database integration patterns for PostgreSQL and MongoDB
Defines centralized error handling and logging patterns
limitations: Does not provide a full runnable project scaffold
Does not include deployment or infrastructure configuration
Does not cover automated testing implementation in this skill
Does not include specific ORM configuration or migrations

use_cases.title: Design a REST API
use_cases.description: Create a structured Express or Fastify API with middleware, validation, and error handling.

use_cases.title: Standardize service patterns
use_cases.description: Set consistent architecture and dependency injection patterns across Node.js services.

use_cases.title: Add authentication
use_cases.description: Implement JWT-based login and refresh token flows with clear service boundaries.

prompt_templates.title: Start an Express API
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner setup for a small API
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a minimal Express server with security middleware, JSON parsing, and a health route. Use TypeScript.

prompt_templates.title: Add validation middleware
prompt_templates.scenario: Validate inputs for a user route
prompt_templates.prompt: Show Zod validation middleware for a create user route and explain how to attach it to Express routes.

prompt_templates.title: Design layered services
prompt_templates.scenario: Build a service and repository pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline controller, service, and repository files for a user resource with dependency injection.

prompt_templates.title: Add JWT auth flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide JWT authentication and authorization middleware and describe how to secure an admin route.

output_examples.input: Outline a Node.js backend structure with middleware and auth
output: Define controllers, services, repositories, and middleware folders
Add JWT authentication middleware and role-based authorization
Set up validation middleware for request bodies
Include centralized error handling and request logging

best_practices: Use TypeScript and input validation for safer APIs
Centralize error handling and structured logging
Keep controllers thin and move logic to services
anti_patterns: Put database queries directly in route handlers
Return raw errors with stack traces in production
Skip rate limiting on authentication endpoints

faq.question: Is this compatible with Express and Fastify?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes guidance and examples for both Express and Fastify.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples, not a full project scaffold or deployment setup.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing Node.js services?
faq.answer: Yes. You can adopt specific patterns like middleware, DI, or error handling.

faq.question: Does it access or transmit sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. The skill is static guidance and does not execute or transmit data.

faq.question: What if my service fails during setup?
faq.answer: Check environment variables, middleware order, and error handler placement.

faq.question: How does this compare to general Node.js guides?
faq.answer: It focuses on concrete backend patterns for structure, security, and maintainability.
